results.title: Touch the Sun : Devil's Hill (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Jill Robb, Esben Storm and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Touch the Sun’.
Badge, a young boy, lives with his parents on a struggling farm in the Tasmanian bush. When Badge’s city cousins come to stay he finds their brash opinions unsettling. Following a violent storm the farm’s viability is threatened by the death of one cow and the escape of another. The children’s quest to recapture the cow leads them to the mysterious crag, Devil’s Hill. In conquering the perils of the mountain the children set aside their bickering and discover the value of co-operation. Rated: G
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jill Robb, Esben Storm and Australian Children’s Television Foundation

results.title: Touch the Sun : Captain Johnno (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Mario Andreacchio, Jane Ballantyne and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Touch the Sun Series”.
Johnno, an energetic and sensitive 10 year old, resides in a small coastal fishing town. His father’s inability to come to terms with Johnno’s deafness exacerbates their already troubled relationship. To curb Johnno’s rebelliousness his father proposes to send him to a “special school”. On learning of this plan Johnno flees to a nearby island to live like Robinson Crusoe. An Italian fisherman, who has earlier befriended Johnno, finds him on the island and endeavours to persuade him to return and face his problems. Rated: G
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mario Andreacchio, Jane Ballantyne and Australian Children’s Television Foundation

results.title: Why be physically fit?
results.creator_credit: Richard Miner and Walt Disney Educational Media Company
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Fun to Be Fit Series”.
Adult-child roles are reversed as two children teach their physically unfit uncle the importance of being in good shape. This films shows students how being fit can help them have more energy, look better, feel better and cope with stress.

results.title: Physical fitness
results.creator_credit: Richard Miner, Andrew Duffus and Walt Disney Educational Media Company
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Fun to Be Fit Series”.
Animation and the singing of light-hearted lyrics contrasts the lack of physical activity since machinery has become such a large part of modern life, against the amount of physical activity that was necessary before the advent of such machinery. “We have a different style. But we don’t get enough exercise” are part of the lyrics which introduce this program. However, the video ends on a positive and hopeful note, as mankind is re-educated in the improvements possible to ensure health, happiness, and quality of life by increasing daily physical activities.

results.title: Getting physically fit
results.creator_credit: Richard Miner and Walt Disney Educational Media Company
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Fun to Be Fit Series”.
Shows how to actually achieve physical fitness through a carefully planned program. Students learn the importance of warming-up, stretching and cooling-down exercise and see how results can be attained by maintaining a regular program that gradually increases in frequency or duration.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Miner and Walt Disney Educational Media Company
